homura.utils package¶

Submodules¶

homura.utils.containers module¶

class homura.utils.containers.Map(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: collections.abc.MutableMapping, dict

dict like object but: stored values can be subscribed and attributed.

>>> m = Map(test="test")
>>> m.test is m["test"]
copy() → a shallow copy of D[source]¶
deepcopy()[source]¶
keys() → a set-like object providing a view on D's keys[source]¶

Move stored tensors to a given device

homura.utils.reproductivity module¶

homura.utils.reproductivity.set_deterministic(seed: int = 0)[source]¶

Set seed of torch, random and numpy to 0 for making it deterministic. Because of CUDA’s limitation, this does not make everything deterministic, however.

homura.utils.reproductivity.set_seed(seed: int = 0)[source]¶
homura.utils.reproductivity.unset_deterministic()[source]¶

Unset seed and set cudnn stochastic.

homura.utils.reproductivity.unset_seed()[source]¶

class homura.utils.runner.Runner(model: torch.nn.modules.module.Module, callbacks: Optional[homura.callbacks.Callback] = None, device: torch.device = None, use_cudnn_benchmark=True, use_cuda_nonblocking=False, logger: Optional[logging.Logger] = None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object
